title: Endless wonders of Bangkok (Deepak Nangla)
locations: west bank of Chao Phraya River
text: By Deepak Nangla Aug 19, 2015 Only once in a while do you come across a place that offers you such warmth that you can let yourself loose and explore the destination just like a local. This is the magic of Bangkok - the most sought after city of the world. Bangkok's popularity as a tourist destination has climbed to great heights. Its numerous attractions, rich cultural background, great shopping atmosphere, an array of gastronomic delights, ideal accommodation facilities and above all a warm attitude are some of the attributes that are responsible for this success. No wonder, tourists from different parts of the world, search for cheap flights to Bangkok to visit this amazing place and enjoy a vacation like no other. Ornate Attractions Bangkok has had an impressive culture. Its ornate architectural structures have stood from ancient times and are now an integral part of Bangkok's tourism. Wat Phra Kaew:- Wat Phra Kaew or the Temple of Emerald Buddha is one of the most sacred Buddhist temples in Thailand. Located within the periphery of the Grand Palace, it preserves the highly revered Buddha image in the meditating position, beautifully carved out of a single block of jade. Wat Pho:- Also known as the Temple of the Reclining Buddha, this gorgeous temple is famous for its impressive statue of the Reclining Buddha, measuring 15 metres in height and 46 metres in length. Wat Arun:- This iconic Temple of Dawn built on the west bank of Chao Phraya River is one of the most stunning structures in terms of both design and location and as contrary to its name, it is absolutely spectacular at sunset and at night, when it gets lit up. Loha Prasat Temple:- This amazing heritage temple also known as the 'Metal Castle' stands out for its unique design and architectural brilliance. Great Food Food is a significant part of any travel experience in Bangkok. Rich in flavours and colourful in appearance, Thailand's delicacies will treat your taste buds like no other. Bangkok is undoubtedly a paradise for gourmet lovers and so is also known as the 'Land of Exciting Food'. From plush restaurants to unpretentious riverside eateries and joints, Bangkok has innumerable options with each one of them serving authentic Thai dishes. Travellers can relish a sumptuous meal of Thai specialties such as Gai Haw Bai Toey, Thai Green Curry, Krathong Tong, Lad Na and Gaeng Mussaman. Affordable Luxuries Thailand is known as the Land of Smiles because it gives you the chance to indulge yourself in the ultimate luxuries of wellness and comfort at affordable rates. Bangkok has a multitude of massage parlours and spas where you can rejuvenate and relax your spirits like never before. No trip to the city is complete without a relaxing session in one of its amazing spas. Bangkok is a complete package in itself.
